Image analysis

Data and code organization

  • The gray box shows the data and image processing for one embryo.

  • The texts and arrows represent data and image processing steps respectively.

  • Important image proceesing steps are labeled with circled numbers.

  • Input and output is labeled blue and green respectively.

  • Purple shows how the threshold is calculated from embryos of the same phenotype. Red texts indicate that they are the same data. Segmentation is broken into two steps because the threshold depends on ROK temporal derivative over time for all embryos of the same phenotype.

  • Analyze one embryo
    • ① segmentation I
    • ② segmentation II
    • ③ summary statistics
    • ④ pixel intensity in binary mask at a range of time offsets
  • Input
    • raw tiff image stacks and table of all embryos
    • label pixels in the embryo
    • label pulsing regions in the embryo
  • Output
    • apply the same function to a list of embryos
    • return function output as a dictionary
  • Example jupyter notebook
    • Segment pulses of activity in videos
      • table of all embryos
      • read raw tiff image
      • pixels in the embryo
      • correct photobleach
      • grouped average in time
      • excitation = temporal derivative > threshold
    • ROK temporal difference in labled pulsing regions
    • Measure summary statistics
      • detect contour of excitation regions
      • measure polygon local deformations perpendicular to its edge
      • link polygons recursively to map pulse trajectories
      • measure periodicity of local time series
